posts.post_content:
*Oh don't act so smart. You don't even know what an oubliette is.

posts.post_content:
Yes, at face value it helps your cre and all the junk you threw on it, but I suppose what the designers had in mind was the potential super specific plays you can combine with this... this is a kind of card that can be very sneaky... I think they had the right idea, which is basically creating an enchantment that can exile and return card but the drawback is the comes into play/battlefield... that's a big drag, but relative to when it first was printed I'd say not bad... it's cards like this that must have played their part in the games development and progress to some really amazing enchantments out there...
  
   
so for the moment, here's to a card that's a bit in exile itself.
  
   
Now as for the card itself- the artwork.. ah, this card is doomy looking, excellent feel.
posts.html:
Yes, at face value it helps your cre and all the junk you threw on it, but I suppose what the designers had in mind was the potential super specific plays you can combine with this... this is a kind of card that can be very sneaky... I think they had the right idea, which is basically creating an enchantment that can exile and return card but the drawback is the comes into play/battlefield... that's a big drag, but relative to when it first was printed I'd say not bad... it's cards like this that must have played their part in the games development and progress to some really amazing enchantments out there...

so for the moment, here's to a card that's a bit in exile itself.

Now as for the card itself- the artwork.. ah, this card is doomy looking, excellent feel.

Posted By: Chrs84 (10/29/2009 1:47:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: No one has commented yet that this is one of the few RELIABLE removal spells that black has. It is better to play this than Assassinate, Dark Banishing, etc, because it can target that many more threats more often. Comparing a black removal spell to the cheap white ones is really unfair. This card compares closest I think to Unmake, however the 1BB instead of BBB makes it far easier to cast if you are playing Wasteland or other colorless lands like Mishra's Factory. Also, it gets around protection from white unlike Unmake.
posts.html:

This card compares closest I think to Unmake, however the 1BB instead of BBB makes it far easier to cast if you are playing Wasteland or other colorless lands like Mishra's Factory. Also, it gets around protection from white unlike Unmake.
